FacilityName: E. B. Harris Electric Generating Plant
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_prev_prog_3.Description: Anhydrous Ammonia used in NOx reduction

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Southern Power Company?s Plant Harris, located near Prattville, Alabama is a 2-unit combined cycle electric generating plant.

Plant Harris has a Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR) System at both Units 1 and 2 to control emissions of nitrogen oxides generated from burning gas to produce electricity.  As part of the system, vaporous ammonia is injected in to the flue gas that aids in the chemical reaction to convert NOx to harmless nitrogen and water vapor.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored on the plant site for use in the SCR system.  The total quantity of ammonia exceeds the threshold limit of 10,000 lbs.  A Process Safety Management (PSM) program is in effect under OSHA for Plant Harris, therefore Program 3 applies.

The main hazard that would be associated with ammonia at Plant Harris is a toxic hazard.  Based on EPA criteria, the worst case scenario is the catastrophic failure of one of the 18,000-gallon ammonia storage tanks.  This would result in the ammonia gas traveling 1.4 miles (2.169 Kilometers) before it reached the endpoint.  However, this type of failure is extremely unlikely due to the safeguards described in the prevention program.  

The worst of several alternative release scenarios considered for the release of ammonia was due to a fault in the piping leading to a release.  A failure of this type would result in ammonia gas traveling <0.1 km before it reached its endpoint.  There are numerous mechanical and procedural safeguards at the Plant to prevent this from occurring.  However, for emergency response planning purposes, they were not considered in the alternative release scenario.

The accidental release prevention program at Plant Harris is focused on the safe management of anhydrous ammonia used in the ammonia storage and dilution system for SCR use.  The first step in the prevention program was the establishment of a management system to assign overall responsibility of the individual program elements.  Additional steps include:  accessibility,

ensuring the system is designed and modified safely by periodically conducting process hazard analyses; ensuring the system is operated and maintained in a safe manner by developing, maintaining and implementing Standard Operating and Preventive Maintenance procedures; ensuring contractors are qualified and oriented to the site hazards; and ensuring periodic Compliance Audits and Incident Investigations are conducted including resolution of recommendations made during these investigations/reviews.

No chemical spills have occurred at this facility.

Plant Harris is included in the Autauga County LEPC emergency response plan.  In addition, the Plant has in place an emergency action plan that includes procedures to be followed in the event of an accidental release of ammonia.  The procedures cover the following: evacuation plan; recognizing emergencies; emergency action procedures; coordinating personnel; first aid procedures; notifying the public and local emergency response agencies; emergency response contacts; emergency response equipment; reportable release quantities and documenting releases; emergency alarm system; training; and pre-emergency coordination with the Autauga County LEPC.
